bug.summary: A bug in core/conversions which makes the module fail in higher version of PyTorch
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
There is a function called "rotation_matrix_to_quaternion", in line 302 ~ line 304, there is code like following: <denchmark-code> mask_c1 = mask_d2 * (1 - mask_d0_d1) mask_c2 = (1 - mask_d2) * mask_d0_nd1 mask_c3 = (1 - mask_d2) * (1 - mask_d0_nd1) </denchmark-code>
The "1 - boolean tensor " operation will cause PyTorch to raise an error: Subtraction, the - operator, with a bool tensor is not supported. If you are trying to invert a mask, use the ~ or logical_not() operator instead. from my understanding, the "1 - boolean tensor" is doing the same thing as logical not. So I replaced that piece of code as: <denchmark-code> mask_c1 = mask_d2 * torch.logical_not( mask_d0_d1) mask_c2 = torch.logical_not( mask_d2) * mask_d0_nd1 mask_c3 = torch.logical_not( mask_d2) * torch.logical_not( mask_d0_nd1) </denchmark-code>
And it worked. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch Version (1.51): OS (Windows):
